channel.title: Players can not connect to my rsps
channel.description:
My server is currently running on Rune-Evo V3 and my client is Foxtrot 718. I am currently portforwarded to 43595 and it is correctly set up, I used canyouseeme.org to test it and it worked. The ip on the loader.java and configuration.java is set to my no-ip address for my public client, but when I try to run it on another computer it gives me the following error,
Exception in thread "main" java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: client : Unsupported major.minor version 52.0 at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass1(Native Method) at java.lang.ClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.security.SecureClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.defineClass(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader.access$100(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.net.URLClassLoader$1.run(Unknown Source) at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method) at java.net.URLClassLoader.findClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at sun.misc.Launcher$AppClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(Unknown Source) at Loader.startClient(Loader.java:115) at Loader.doFrame(Loader.java:52) at Loader.main(Loader.java:36) Press any key to continue . . .
When I have the ip set for 127.0.0.1 it works just fine for me but no one else. What do I do? I'm sure someone has a solution.

item.title: Players can not connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:8, topic:545978”][quote author=ItsNateDuh link=topic=664870.msg4444673#msg4444673 date=1408171241]

You compiled on JDK 1.8 and are running it on JRE 1.7 for the error.
Compile on JDK 1.7 to fix it or get JRE 1.8 on the other computer.
127.0.0.1 is localhost. If you’re on the same computer as the server, you have to connect using localhost.
Everyone else should be able to connect to your IP found at http://whatismyip.com
Make sure windows firewall or other anti virus programs aren’t blocking the port.

If I were just to make it into a jar file would that fix it? And if I did how would I do it because most youtube videos say to use jar maker and in the client folder there would be a sign folder but mine doesn’t have one.

You should be making a jar regardless, but that won’t fix anything unless the jar is made with JRE 1.7, and that can only be done if it’s compiled on JDK 1.7
There doesn’t >have< to be a sign folder. That’s only if your signlink is packaged into the sign folder.
Just make sure it’s set to the folder with the class files in it.

Will the 1.7 compile work with 1.8 jdk?

Yes.
You can run data compiled on JDK 1.7 on JRE 1.8

Every time I create my jar file it never runs, I create the keystore, create the jar, and sign it, and now that I installed jre 1.7 I switched to the jar signer.exe in the bin folder but it still doesn’t work
[/quote]
When you create the jar file, make sure the “create .bat file” is checked.
When finish making the jar, run it using the bat file you just made. Post errors.[/quote]
Error: Main method not found in class client, please define the main met
public static void main(String[] args)
or a JavaFX application class must extend javafx.application.Application

Read full topic
item.source: Players can not connect to my rsps

item.title: Players can not connect to my rsps
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“ItsNateDuh, post:7, topic:545978”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=664870.msg4444668#msg4444668 date=1408169350]

You compiled on JDK 1.8 and are running it on JRE 1.7 for the error.
Compile on JDK 1.7 to fix it or get JRE 1.8 on the other computer.
127.0.0.1 is localhost. If you’re on the same computer as the server, you have to connect using localhost.
Everyone else should be able to connect to your IP found at http://whatismyip.com
Make sure windows firewall or other anti virus programs aren’t blocking the port.

If I were just to make it into a jar file would that fix it? And if I did how would I do it because most youtube videos say to use jar maker and in the client folder there would be a sign folder but mine doesn’t have one.

You should be making a jar regardless, but that won’t fix anything unless the jar is made with JRE 1.7, and that can only be done if it’s compiled on JDK 1.7
There doesn’t >have< to be a sign folder. That’s only if your signlink is packaged into the sign folder.
Just make sure it’s set to the folder with the class files in it.

Will the 1.7 compile work with 1.8 jdk?

Yes.
You can run data compiled on JDK 1.7 on JRE 1.8
[/quote]
Every time I create my jar file it never runs, I create the keystore, create the jar, and sign it, and now that I installed jre 1.7 I switched to the jar signer.exe in the bin folder but it still doesn’t work[/quote]
When you create the jar file, make sure the “create .bat file” is checked.
When finish making the jar, run it using the bat file you just made. Post errors.

item.dc:creator: @ItsNateDuh ItsNateDuh
item.description:
@ItsNateDuh wrote:

[quote=“sk8rdude461, post:6, topic:545978”][quote author=ItsNateDuh link=topic=664870.msg4444661#msg4444661 date=1408166751]

You compiled on JDK 1.8 and are running it on JRE 1.7 for the error.
Compile on JDK 1.7 to fix it or get JRE 1.8 on the other computer.
127.0.0.1 is localhost. If you’re on the same computer as the server, you have to connect using localhost.
Everyone else should be able to connect to your IP found at http://whatismyip.com
Make sure windows firewall or other anti virus programs aren’t blocking the port.

If I were just to make it into a jar file would that fix it? And if I did how would I do it because most youtube videos say to use jar maker and in the client folder there would be a sign folder but mine doesn’t have one.

You should be making a jar regardless, but that won’t fix anything unless the jar is made with JRE 1.7, and that can only be done if it’s compiled on JDK 1.7
There doesn’t >have< to be a sign folder. That’s only if your signlink is packaged into the sign folder.
Just make sure it’s set to the folder with the class files in it.

Will the 1.7 compile work with 1.8 jdk?
[/quote]
Yes.
You can run data compiled on JDK 1.7 on JRE 1.8[/quote]
Every time I create my jar file it never runs, I create the keystore, create the jar, and sign it, and now that I installed jre 1.7 I switched to the jar signer.exe in the bin folder but it still doesn’t work
